articles.title: Trump plans to close Kennedy Center for about two years, starting in July - The Washington Post
articles.description: Under a proposal by President Donald Trump, the closure could begin July 4, with construction beginning immediately.

articles.title: Bad Bunny Makes Grammys History as First Spanish-Language Album of the Year Winner - Variety
articles.description: Bad Bunny has made Grammy history as the first Spanish-language artist to win album of the year.

articles.title: 'TODAY' Anchor Savannah Guthrie’s Mom Missing - TMZ
articles.description: Authorities in Arizona are searching for Nancy Guthrie, the mother of 'TODAY' anchor Savannah Guthrie, who was reported missing under what authorities are calling concerning circumstances.

articles.title: Winners and nominees at the 2026 Grammy Awards - updating live - BBC
articles.description: An updating guide to the main prizes at Sunday's 68th Grammy Awards in Los Angeles.

articles.title: Host Trevor Noah takes aim at Nicki Minaj, goes easy on Kendrick Lamar at Grammys - AP News
articles.description: Hosting the Grammy Awards for the sixth and final time, Trevor Noah poked fun at stars but went light on politics. During his monologue, he joked about Nicki Minaj meeting and praising Donald Trump at the White House, getting a big cheer when he said Minaj wa…

articles.title: Kendrick Lamar Makes Grammys History as Most-Awarded Rapper, Breaking Jay-Z’s Record - Variety
articles.description: Kendrick Lamar has made Grammys history in becoming the most-awarded rap artist, beating the record previously held by Jay-Z.

articles.title: The Greatness of Catherine O’Hara - The Free Press
articles.description: The loss of one of our greatest comediennes is shocking—as was the consistent brilliance of her work, writes John Podhoretz.

articles.title: Amazon’s ‘Melania’ documentary makes $7M on opening weekend - TechCrunch
articles.description: While the documentary is exceeding box office expectations, it's unlikely to make a profit in theaters.

articles.title: Ifunanya Nwangene: Aspiring Nigerian singer dies after snakebite in Abuja - BBC
articles.description: Ifunanya Nwangene, a former contestant in The Voice Nigeria, died after not getting the antivenom she needed.
